headline: Is It Time To Reassess American Electric Power (AEP) After Its 32.7% One-Year Rally?
summary: If you are wondering whether American Electric Power Company is still fairly priced after its strong run, you are not alone. Many investors are asking the same question right now. The stock last closed at US$115.81, and over the past year it has returned 32.7%, compared with a 1.5% decline over the last 30 days and flat performance year to date. Recent news coverage around American Electric Power Company has focused on its position as a large regulated utility and its role in supporting...

headline: The Bull Case For Quanta Services (PWR) Could Change Following Major Grid And Data Center Expansion - Learn Why
summary: In recent months, Quanta Services has emerged as a primary contractor in American Electric Power’s approximately US$72.00 billion transmission and power delivery upgrade program, while also expanding its data center infrastructure capabilities through the acquisitions of Dynamic Systems and Cupertino Electric. This combination of major utility work and enhanced data center power expertise highlights Quanta’s expanding role at the intersection of grid investment and digital infrastructure...
